solution_line_template: On Monday and Wednesday, Rosie runs {speed_mph}*{mon_run_hours}= <<{speed_mph}*{mon_run_hours}={mon_miles}>>{mon_miles} miles.
On Tuesday, Rosie runs {speed_mph}*({tue_run_minutes} minutes/{minutes_per_hour} minutes) = <<{speed_mph}*({tue_run_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour})={tue_miles}>>{tue_miles} miles.
On Thursday, Rosie runs {speed_mph}*({thu_run_minutes} minutes/{minutes_per_hour} minutes)=<<{speed_mph}*({thu_run_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour})={thu_miles}>>{thu_miles} miles.
So far this week Rosie has run {mon_miles}+{tue_miles}+{wed_miles}+{thu_miles}=<<{mon_miles}+{tue_miles}+{wed_miles}+{thu_miles}={total_miles_so_far}>>{total_miles_so_far} miles.
To reach her goal, she must run {weekly_goal}-{total_miles_so_far}=<<{weekly_goal}-{total_miles_so_far}={miles_needed_friday}>>{miles_needed_friday} miles on Friday.
Thus, she should run for {miles_needed_friday}/{speed_mph}=.5 hour which is {friday_run_minutes} minutes.
